emailNotFound.header: There is no benefit appeal associated with this email address
emailNotFound.body:
Either you have changed your email address or you do not have an active benefit appeal.

If you have changed your email address then you need to create a new account using your new email address:

technicalError.header: There is a technical problem with your account
technicalError.body:
There is a technical problem with the account you are using to access your benefit appeal.

Please email {{ i18n.contactEmail }} and we will resolve it for you. Include your appeal reference number and name.

We apologise for any inconvenience.

cannotUseService.body: Please check any emails or letters you have received about your benefit appeal if you would like an update.

taskList.noQuestions: You have no questions from the tribunal

deadline.completed: You have answered all the questions and submmitted them to the tribunal.

sendingEvidence.intro: You can provide additional information that’s relevant to your appeal. You don’t have to provide anything if you don’t have it.

details.para1: You can either email it or send it by post. Make sure it’s clearly marked with your appeal reference number:
details.closingPara1: If you are posting it in, send the tribunal an email briefly describing what you are posting and when you think it will arrive. Use the email address above.
details.closingPara2: Try to send it as soon as possible to avoid delaying your appeal.

textareaField.label: Please enter your answer here
textareaField.placeholder: You can write as much as you want

error.empty: You have not entered any information so you cannot save your answer. Enter some information before saving.
error.maxCharacters: You have entered over 10,000 characters. Reduce the amount you have written and try again.

evidenceUpload.checkbox: I want to provide evidence to support my answer
evidenceUpload.header: Provide evidence to support your answer
evidenceUpload.info: You can upload evidence to support your answer such as letters, photos and documents. If you are taking a picture of a letter, place it on a flat surface and take the picture from above.

postEvidence.summary: You can also post evidence to the tribunal

details.para1: You can post evidence to the address below.
details.para2: Make sure it’s clearly marked with your appeal reference number:
details.closingPara1: Try to post it as soon as possible to avoid delaying your appeal.
details.closingPara2: Tell the tribunal in your answer if you plan on posting evidence. Briefly describe what you are posting and say when you think it will arrive.

sendingEvidence.summary: Sending evidence to support your answer

details.para1: If you have any evidence to support your answer, you can either email it or send it by post.
details.para2: Make sure it’s clearly marked with your appeal reference number:
details.closingPara1: Useful evidence helps prove what you have said in your answer such as a letter from a doctor or someone who knows you well. You do not have to send in evidence if you don’t have any.
details.closingPara2: If you are posting it in, send the tribunal an email briefly describing what you are posting and when you think it will arrive. Use the email address above.

questionUploadEvidence.label: Choose file
questionUploadEvidence.sizeWarning: Larger files may take a few minutes to upload

error.empty: You have not selected a file.
error.tooLarge: The file you have uploaded is too big. Please upload a file under
error.invalidFileType: The type of file you have uploaded is not acceptable. Please convert it to a common file format and try again.

submitQuestion.title: You will not be able to change your answer after you submit it.

questionsCompleted.header: You have answered the tribunal’s questions
questionsCompleted.para1: You’ve provided the information the tribunal have asked for. They’ll review what you’ve sent and consider it as part of your appeal.
questionsCompleted.para2End: which will explain how the tribunal want to proceed with your appeal.

extendDeadline.header: Extending the deadline will delay your appeal
extendDeadline.hint: You can have another week to answer the questions but your appeal will take longer.
extendDeadline.subheader: Do you still want to extend the deadline?

no.header: You have not extended the deadline
no.para1: You still have until {{ deadline }} to answer the questions.

yes.header: You have another week to answer the questions
yes.para1: You now have until {{ deadline }} to answer the questions.

contactTribunal.para1: You need to contact the tribunal and explain why you need more time.
contactTribunal.para2: Send an email explaining why you need more time and the date you can respond by to:
contactTribunal.para3: Your reasons will be reviewed by a judge.
contactTribunal.para4: You will then receive another email telling you whether you have been granted additional time and how the tribunal wish to proceed.

error.text: You need to say whether you want to extend the deadline before continuing

tribunalView.headerText: You have to say whether you accept it by {{ respondBy }}. You can do this at the bottom of the page.
tribunalView.whatNextPara: You can accept the view or if you feel the view is wrong you can have a face to face hearing.
tribunalView.acceptRespondBy: You have to respond to this question by {{ respondBy }}. If you don’t respond we will assume you are accepting the view and it will be sent to you.

error.empty: You must accept the tribunal's view or request a hearing.

tribunalViewConfirm.header: Are you sure you want to accept the view?
tribunalViewConfirm.headerText: You will not be able to change your mind.
tribunalViewConfirm.acceptYes: Yes, I want to accept the view
tribunalViewConfirm.acceptNo: No, I want to go back
tribunalViewConfirm.acceptHelp: If you need help deciding then you could talk to your representative or a friend or family member who know about your condition.

tribunalViewAccepted.header: You have accepted the tribunal’s view
tribunalViewAccepted.para1: This view has also been communicated to DWP.
tribunalViewAccepted.para2: If they accept, the decision will be issued and your appeal will be closed.
tribunalViewAccepted.para3: If they request a hearing, you will be asked if you want to attend.
tribunalViewAccepted.para4: You will get an email telling you whether they have accepted the view by {{ nextCorrespondenceDate }}.

tribunalDecision.header: The tribunal’s decision on your appeal

outcome.decision_rejected: Your appeal has not been successful

tribunalDecision.postInfo: A formal decision notice has also been sent to your registered postal address.

hearingConfirm.header: A new tribunal panel will decide your appeal
hearingConfirm.para: A new tribunal panel will make a decision on your appeal. This may be different from the view already given.
hearingConfirm.legend: Do you still want a hearing?

error.title: There are errors on this page
error.text: You need to say whether you still want a hearing

hearingWhy.header: Explain why you want a hearing

error.empty: You have not entered any information so you cannot submit your request for a hearing. Enter some information before saving.
error.maxCharacters: You have entered over 10,000 characters. Reduce the amount you have written and try again.

booking.header: A hearing needs to be booked for your appeal
booking.para1: You'll receive an email with the details of your hearing by {{ responseDate }}.
booking.para2: If you require a hearing room with disabled access or any other support then please email the tribunal at
booking.para3: Include your appeal reference number on any emails to the tribunal:

cookieBanner.message: GOV.UK uses cookies to make the site simpler.

cookiePrivacy.titleHead: Cookie Policy - Appeal a benefit decision - GOV.UK

cookies.title: Cookies
cookies.description: A cookie is a small piece of data that’s stored on your computer, tablet, or phone when you visit a website. Most websites need cookies to work properly.

usedInService.title: How cookies are used in this service
usesList: measure how you use the service so it can be improved
remember the notifications you’ve seen so that you’re not shown them again
temporarily store the answers you give

howAreTheyUsed.title: Cookies used to measure website usage
howAreTheyUsed.description: We use Google Analytics software to collect information about how you use this service. We do this to help make sure the service is meeting the needs of its users and to help us make improvements, for example improving site search.
infoList: how long you spend on each page
how you got to the service
what you click on while you’re visiting the service
howAreTheyUsed.googleShare: We allow Google to use or share this data. Find out more about how they use this information in the

optOut.access: if you do not want Google to have access to your information.

howAreTheyUsed.googleCookies: Google Analytics sets the following cookies:

items.name: _ga
items.purpose: This helps us count how many people visit the service by tracking if you’ve visited before

introMessage.title: Cookies used to turn our introductory message off
introMessage.description: You may see a welcome message when you first visit the service. We’ll store a cookie so that your computer knows not to show this message again.

items.name: seen_cookie_message
items.purpose: Saves a message to let us know that you’ve seen our cookie message

sessionCookie.title: Cookies used to store the answers you’ve given during your visit (known as a ‘session’)
sessionCookie.description: Session cookies are stored on your computer as you browse a website, and let the website know what you’ve seen and done so far. These are temporary cookies and are automatically deleted after you leave the website.
